snippet: In defending Hillary Clinton’s email practices, the president offered a concession his administration has not always made with news organizations or security officials.
abstract: News Analysis; Pres Obama's defense of Hillary Rodham Clinton's email practices, in which he noted that there are distinctions between genuinely secret and merely sensitive classified information, is at odds with way that his administration has in past aggressively prosecuted government officials, news organizations and whistle blowers who leaked information.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and MARK LANDLER
byline.contributor: Scott Shane in Washington contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: In defending Hillary Clinton’s email practices, the president offered a concession his administration has not always made with news organizations or security officials.

headline.main: Obama’s Latest View on Secrecy Overlooks Past Prosecution of Leaks
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Latest View on Secrecy Overlooks Past Prosecution of Leaks
